qas.question: Who could be made vulnerable by the Gasemtschulen?
From what group does an achievement gap separate working class students at comprehensive schools?
At which school do students achieve the least success?
Who couldn't be made vulnerable by the Gasemtschulen?
Who could be protected by the Gasemtschulen?
From what group doesn't an achievement gap separate working class students at comprehensive schools?
From what group does an achievement gap separate working class students at uncomprehensive schools?
At which school do students achieve the most success?

context: Gesamtschulen might put <a0_0><b3_0><b4_0>bright working class students<b4_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/> at risk according to several studies. It could be shown that an achievement gap opens between working class students attending a comprehensive and their <a1_0><b5_0><b6_0>middle class peers<b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/>. Also working class students attending a Gymnasium or a Realschule outperform students from similar backgrounds attending a comprehensive. However it is not students attending a comprehensive, but students attending a <a2_0><b7_0>Hauptschule<b7_0/><a2_0/>, who perform the poorest.
